description: Imports an external css file into the current file's rules

values.description: Used for all media type devices
Used for speech and sound synthesizers
Used for braille tactile feedback devices
Used for small or handheld devices
Used for projected presentations, like slides
Used for media using a fixed-pitch character grid, like teletypes and terminals

description: Matches Elem1 with the [Prefix] namespace prefix
name: Namespace Selector

description: Matches any element
name: Universal Selector

description: Matches specified Element name
name: Simple Element Selector

description: Elem1 is the direct or indirect ancestor of Elem2
name: Descendent Selectors

description: Elem1 is the direct parent of Elem2
name: Child Selectors

description: Elem1 and Elem2 share the same direct parent AND are next to each other in the document tree
name: Adjacent Selectors

description: Matches all elements with the specified attribute or all "Elem"s with the specified attribute
name: Simple Attribute Selector

description: Matches all elements that exactly match the specified attribute/value or all "Elem"s with the specified attribute/value
name: Attribute Value Selector

description: Matches all elements with the specified attribute that BEGIN with the specified value. This selector would match attribute values that are equal to it as well as to longer values of which it is a substring.
name: "Begins-with" Attribute Value Selector

description: Matches all elements with the specified attribute that END with the specified value. This selector would match attribute values that are equal to it as well as to longer values of which it is a substring.
name: "Ends-with" Attribute Value Selector

description: Matches all element/attribute combinations that have at least one occurrence of the indicated value as a substring.
name: Substring-match Attribute Value Selector

description: Allows a portion of an attribute value to be exactly matched where the portions are separated by spaces.
name: One-of-many Attribute Value Selector

description: The attribute value is a hyphen-separated list and begins with "value"
name: Hyphen Attribute Value Selector

description: The attribute is in the specified Namespace prefix.
name: Namespace Attribute Selector

description: Matches the document's root element. In HTML, the root element is always the HTML element.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the n-th child of its parent.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the n-th child of its parent, counting from the last child.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the n-th sibling of its type.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the n-th sibling of its type, counting from the last sibling.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the last child of its parent.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the first sibling of its type.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the last sibling of its type.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the only child of its parent.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that is the only sibling of its type.
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches any E element that has no children (including text nodes).
name: Structural pseudo-class

description: Matches an E element that is the target of the referring URL.
name: Target pseudo-class

description: Matches any user interface element (form control) E that is enabled.
name: UI element states pseudo-class

description: Matches any user interface element (form control) E that is disabled.
name: UI element states pseudo-class

description: Matches any user interface element (form control) E that is checked.
name: UI element states pseudo-class

description: Matches the portion of an element E that is currently selected or highlighted by the user.
name: UI element fragments pseudo-element

description: Matches any E element that does not match the simple selector s.
name: Negation pseudo-class

description: Matches any F element that is preceded by an E element.
name: General sibling combinator

description: Matches elements with CLASS attributes carrying a [Class Name] value
name: Class Selector

description: Matches the element carrying the unique ID attribute value of [ID Name]
name: ID Selector

description: Addresses content that is generated before an element
name: Before

description: Addresses content that is generated after an element
name: After

description: Indicates the first rendered letter/character for a block-level element
name: First-letter

description: Indicates the first rendered line on the output device of a block-level element
name: First-line

description: Addresses content that is generated before an element
name: Before

description: Addresses content that is generated after an element
name: After

description: Indicates the first rendered letter/character for a block-level element
name: First-letter

description: Indicates the first rendered line on the output device of a block-level element
name: First-line

description: Applies to an unvisited hyperlink
name: Link

description: Applies to a visited hyperlink
name: Visited

description: Applies to the first child/descendent of an element
name: First-child

description: The state during pointer activation ( eg: press and release of a mouse)
name: Active

description: The state during pointer movement within the rendering region of an element
name: Hover

description: The state during which an element accepts keyboard input
name: Focus

description: The selector content uses the specified language
name: Lang

description: Rules to apply to the first page
name: Lang

description: rules to apply to left pages
name: Lang

description: rules to apply to right pages
name: Lang
